page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There are alot of old houses around Ashover.The school its self was built in 1877.There used to be a school up the Rattle I think it is used for an old peoples home now.Farm houses are scatterd all around Ashover itself,but most of the buildings in Ashover are now used by commuters who travel to places like Matlock to go to work. People who travelled there would probably work at the County Offices. Chesterfield is another place where people might work along with,Derby, Nottingham and Sheffield. Some houses were built quite early heres a list_:Ambervale Hydro was built in 1888,Bath House Farm was built in 1720,and convented to a poor house in 1767,Ashover Hill School was built in 1703.There is a new house up the Rattle called Amberstone house it has a swimming pool indoors.
